items.title: Senior Salesforce Developer (4+ years) at sailteam.io ()
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Cloud Computing, Recruiting, SaaS
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Salesforce Developer (4+ years of experience)

  • Deep experience in Javascript, Apex development
  • Ideal candidate has experience working with Lightning components 
  • 100% remote; also open to onsite in Brooklyn, NY
  • No sponsorship being offered

Morgan and Morgan Law Firm is hiring a 4+ year Salesforce Developer for a permanent, remote role. The client is a major end-user of Salesforce and this person will report to the head of all Technical Architecture for their SFDC instance. Additional members of the team include a Senior Salesforce Developer, several Admins and a VP of Platform. Some examples of projects queued for a developer of this nature include:

  • Development of a system for reconciling traditional media attribution
  • Working with the director of digital advertising to streamline reporting across all major channels
  • Implementing call-quality metric tracking (e.g. avg hold time, avg call duration, etc.)

A creative thinker who wants to help improve our call center and marketing processes is also a huge plus. Requirements:

  • Schedule and attend project meetings & daily stand ups
  • Experience working with external API’s (Twilio, Google Analytics, etc.)
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Maintain personal project tickets via JIRA
  • 6+ years experience development applications
  • 4+ years experience in Salesforce related development
  • Salesforce Platform Development I certification
  • Experience with configuring and integration between Salesforce and Marketing Cloud.
  • Significant experience with integrations in to and out of Salesforce including custom development Apex integrations

Preferred

  • Experience with digital advertising concepts, specifically in relation to attribution and tracking (UTM vs. Value Track, UTM components, organic vs. paid, etc.)
  • Project management experience
  • Working experience with GIT source control, GitHub, and working familiarity with development lifecycle and release management process
  • Working experience with various data loading options to Salesforce
  • Familiarity with SalesforceDX and Salesforce Packaging 2.0 initiatives.
  • Working experience with Lightning Component development
  • Salesforce Platform Development II certification

Proficiency and Certification Expectations The expectation is that the candidate, within 4 months of hiring, will achieve four out of the following certifications (if not already attained).  The expectation is within 6 months of hiring, candidate will achieve all of the following certifications:

  • Salesforce Certified Administrator
  • Salesforce Certified App Builder
  • Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Consultant
  • Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Email Specialist
  • Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Social Specialist

The expectation is that within 1 year of hiring, candidate will achieve Salesforce Platform Development II certification (if not already attained).

About sailteam.io

This opportunity is with one of the largest Law Firms in the United States on their internal Digital Marketing Team.

Benefits

Unique Clients
Growth Opportunities
Diverse Culture

items.title: Full Stack Javascript Engineer at Clevertech ()
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Full Stack Javascript Engineer to join our global team.

In this role you will have significant responsibility in one of our project development teams to ensure client satisfaction by executing on the deliverables. Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code.

You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 3+ years of full-stack development, or in a similar role.
  • You are experienced with modern JS development practices and frameworks including ES6 and React / Redux. You’ve worked on JS projects at scale and feel confident solving complex problems.
  • Technically, you have an excellent background in data structures, design patterns, and modern programming practices with more than 3 years experience.
  • Experience with Python or Ruby ideally
  • Solid understanding of MySQL
  • Experience building and scaling web applications
  • You believe in writing thorough unit and integration tests and have at least tried TDD. You like owning the quality of the code you write — QA doesn’t mean throwing it over the wall for someone else to test.
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Knowledge about the Lean Startup and Agile Methodologies

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself

You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag

And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.



Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.



Benefits

Full-Time Telecommuting
Flexible Schedules
Paid Time Off
Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
Contribute to Open Source

We’re looking to hire a Software Engineer with VOIP / SIP / FreeSWITCH experience. You’ll help develop a complex communications platform from the ground up. items.title: Remote Technical Lead (Northeast, US) at Twin Technologies (Albany, NY)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Lead
Industry: Consulting, Design, Digital Agency
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Lead and serve as part of a team developing and designing a green field project and have the ability to help steer technology and platform decisions. The ideal candidate is a leader, a team player and is passionate about learning and applying their technical skills and experience to solve real-world problems.

Qualifications:

 Our preference is that you have experience delivering solutions and solving problems using some of the technologies listed below.  That being said, we are looking for individuals that are open and comfortable picking up some of these technologies during the course of our engagement. 

  • Architectural and Design Leadership- You have the experience to lead software architecture efforts that produce flexible, sustainable, and maintainable software platforms.  You are thoughtful in your design approach.
  • Node.js- You possess a deep understanding of core Node.js technologies. Demonstrable versatility in multiple front-end and back-end technologies (Example: JavaScript, ReactJS, Node.js, Spring, AngularJS, CSS3, HTML5, SQL)
  • Experience with source control management using Git
  • Architectural Experience with SOA concepts, REST API design, distributed technologies, and B2B / B2C applications.
  • Objective-C, Java, C#, Java, Go, and Python are all bonuses. We don't necessarily work with all these languages, but want people that have the drive, experience, and mindset to recognize when these languages should be used and why.
  • Understands and embraces the value of automated software deployment and release automation
  • Northeast US Location, with ability to travel if needed
  • Experience working from home and leading distributed teams in a remote model
  • Members of this team will include a Technical Team Lead and supporting engineers, internal Twin UX Researcher/Designer and Operations and Delivery Support.

items.title: Full Stack Developer @ AdBlock, serving 60 million users... at AdBlock ()
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Cybersecurity, Digital Advertising, Digital Media
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

About Us

We are a small team that services the needs of tens of millions of users. We strive to ensure that our users have complete control over their online browsing experience. Our main product, AdBlock, is one of the most popular browser extensions in history and has been downloaded more than 200 million times by users all over the world.  Our products work in all major browsers, including Chrome, Safari, Firefox and Edge, as well as on Apple iOS and Android devices.

We are a distributed team in the United States. While we have a small office in San Francisco, most of our employees work remotely and this role can either be situated in San Francisco, or remotely, depending on what works best for the person that fills it. What unites us is a desire to make it easier and safer for users to surf the Web.


About You
Our development cycle is extremely fast. It's common to write code and have it running in production just a few hours later. If you work for us, you will make an impact, immediately.

AdBlock is seeking software engineers to join our engineering team that are willing to roll up their sleeves and contribute in a number of areas. You can help create web applications that reach millions of people, build high volume servers and be a part of a team that’s reaching tens of millions of AdBlock users.

What You Will Do:

  • Develop new web-based tools and applications to support AdBlock's continued growth as an extension, and as a family of services
  • Maintain and improve the getadblock.com website by writing clean, well-documented code
  • Create and execute QA scripts, test plans, and testing frameworks for popular desktop extensions and the AdBlock website viewed by tens of millions of people
  • Work with design, business development, and customer support to help solve complex user and partner-related product questions

Minimum Qualifications

  • Motivated, intellectually curious, and ready to contribute in multiple areas on a small team
  • Ability to pick up new programming languages, frameworks and APIs quickly
  • High levels of creativity and solid problem-solving abilities
  • Preferred: Python, PHP, or Node.js experience
  • Preferred: HTML, Javascript, and CSS experience
  • Preferred: Demonstrated software engineering experience from previous internship, work experience or an online portfolio (e.g., GitHub)
  • Ability to obtain and maintain work authorization in the United States.

If you are interested in applying, please send resumes and links to your work to careers@getadblock.com. AdBlock is not able to sponsor, obtain, and/or petition for temporary visa status for this role.

About AdBlock

We are a small team that services the needs of tens of millions of users. We strive to ensure that our users have complete control over their online browsing experience. Our main product, AdBlock, is one of the most popular browser extensions in history and has been downloaded more than 200 million times by users all over the world.  Our products work in all major browsers, including Chrome, Safari, Firefox, and Edge, as well as on Apple iOS and Android devices.

We are a distributed team. While we have a small office in San Francisco, most of our employees work remotely and this role can either be situated in San Francisco or remotely, depending on what works best for the person that fills it. What unites us is a desire to make it easier and safer for users to surf the Web.

Benefits

Work remotely
Flexible hours
Startup culture, without the funding woes
MacBook Pro or PC, and equipment you need to be effective at your job
401K + company matching

items.title: JavaScript Developer at Scripto ()
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Enterprise Software, Entertainment, Television
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Hello! We're Scripto, the software company that The New Yorker recently called "a fixture of late-night comedy news." It was a great start to the year, but we have even bigger plans, and we hope you'll apply to join us as a Developer. You'll be working on Showrunner, our next-generation product for screenwriters, sketch groups, sitcoms, and films.

We're looking for someone who enjoys the challenge of connecting users to APIs in an elegant and friendly way; you should be excited at the prospect of architecting and then implementing new mission-critical features that play well with our existing systems. Here's a partial list of the technologies we use every day: Choo, Nanocomponent, Codemirror, Bankai, Take-Five, Postgres, Redis, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, CommonJS, and Node (6, moving to 8). You don't have to know all of those cold, even our CTO picked up (or created!) some of them here at Scripto. What we'd like to see from you is 3-5 years of production JS experience, with a record of shipping software and learning on the fly. You should easily be able to point to complete projects you've devised and built, like features of a large package, or whole apps if they’re on the smaller side. Your work doesn't have to be open-source or public, but it should have real users and stakes.

We are a proudly remote company with flexible hours and health, dental, and vision benefits. We hire inclusively and value diversity. It should be noted, this position is only open to candidates in the USA. To apply, please submit a résumé and cover letter – we can't wait to hear from you.

About Scripto

Scripto began in the early 2010s at the Colbert Report, when writer (and CEO) Rob Dubbin thought there should be a better way for the dozens of people who made the show every day to collaborate. It is now a thriving enterprise product whose clients have won the last six consecutive Emmys for Outstanding Writing in a Comedy/Variety Series. We're a proudly remote company, our employees are leaders in their professional communities, and our culture emphasizes learning on the job and growing into new challenges. We look forward to hearing from you!

Benefits

Medical, Dental, and Vision
Work from Home

Exclamation Labs is a full-service technology agency that is passionate about creating custom digital solutions, particularly in the financial and insurance sector. We provide development expertise to market-leading companies, helping them deliver digital experiences and products that customers love to use.  

We work with a variety of technologies and frameworks. As a full stack developer, you will be primarily working with our Java stack to maintain enterprise-grade websites and applications, but there will be opportunities to work with Node.js, PHP, and other languages and frameworks.

Remote work may be an option only for candidates who live within a reasonable driving distance from our main office as you will be required to attend internal and client meetings periodically. 

You must have:

  • 5+ years of experience in web development

  • Familiarity with Node.js

Other requirements:

  • Must be authorized to work in the United States

Exceptional candidates who do not meet above criteria may be considered for the role provided they have the necessary skills and experience.

About Exclamation Labs

If you apply with us, you should thrive on being challenged by your work.  You must be willing to think outside of traditional solutions and be ahead of the pack in learning newer technologies. Passion for your work should be your first priority.  If this sounds appealing, we want to talk to you!

To Our Clients: We invest in knowing and understanding the digital experience your customers require to enable and inspire the intended outcomes.

To Our Employees: We provide a great place for you to work and grow among a talented team that shares your passion for doing work that creates a positive impact. 

To Our Community: We believe that Cumberland is in the middle of somewhere – somewhere we build on experience and potential that matters wherever you are. 

We are Caring: We have a strong connection to our clients and their organizations; to the work we do, to each other, and to our communities. We not only give our clients what they ask for, but what they need. We’re respectful, candid, and committed to getting the results that best reflect the intentions and desires of the people we work for and work with.

We are Passionate: We show our enthusiasm in everything we do. We take the time to ask the right questions to understand what our clients and colleagues need from us so we always can provide the best information and work product to them. Our curiosity leads us to continuously learn things on our own without being asked. At the end of the day, we aspire to meet the lofty goals we set for ourselves and for our company.

We are Ingenious: We engage in creative problem solving that reflects our talent and ability to address highly complex problems with solutions that we can explain to our clients in simple terms and that easily engage their customers, resulting in the outcomes our clients need for their businesses to succeed.

Salary will be commensurate based on experience. At this time, we are only looking for candidates interested in full-time employment.

All headhunter and contractor submissions will be ignored.

items.title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Leep.It)
items.content:
Senior Full Stack Developer (Leep.It) at ConsenSys

Brooklyn, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Node.js, Peer-to-Peer, Full Stack Development, React.js, Blockchain
Compensation
$90K–$120K
0.0%–0.01%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

ConsenSys is a venture production studio focused on building and scaling tools and software products powered by Ethereum. Our mission is to use these solutions to power the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security, infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this we’ve built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh; a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal under “Meshocracy”, our own operational & company structure loosely based on the principles of holacracy. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are requirements, we would love for you to join us.

What is leep.it?

leep.it (http://leep.it/) is a true peer to peer value discovery and exchange protocol.
We enable participants to discover and translate any asset into another seamlessly, securely and inexpensively. We do this by opening up current silos of liquidity and allowing new ways for participants to trade with each other.
We are building an open-source protocol for true peer-to-peer exchange along with a user interface into this network, and we will incentivize a community of developers to build customized entry points and services.
First this offers an alternative to current exchanges, with the ultimate goal of creating an agile and sustainable global network with customized liquidity, essential to powering the blockchain ecosystem and transforming the way society exchanges value.

Who are we looking for?

* You want to be part of an early stage start up and are comfortable stepping out traditional role boundaries
* You are an expert in JavaScript and Node.JS and keep up to date with the latest developments in back-end technologies, and the latest web standards (HTML, CSS, etc.....)
* You have experience developing and consuming APIs
* You have experience working with distributed systems and a deep appreciation for decentralization
* You have experience working in distributed/remote teams, and are generally self-directed
* You have Financial Services experience: focused on exchanges, trading, order books, and payments
* You have experience working with blockchain technology (e.g. wallets, escrow, multi-sigs) and InterPlanetary File System (IPFS, libp2p)
* You have experience actively contributing to open-source projects
* You have experience working with protocols for p2p networking, storage, and communications
* You have experience working with UNIX / Linux based operating systems
* You cringe at the mundane and have a true conviction to push the bleeding edge of technology
* You are a creative thinker

Bonus points:

* You frequent meet ups and are comfortable speaking to a community of developers
* You have experience working within true agile environments
* You have devops experience - developing microservices, containerization (Docker), SOA
* You have experience working with Conflict-free Replicated Data Types (CRDTs)
* You have experience with reputation systems

Experience with document management systems

items.title: Shopify Selling Expert
items.content:
Doubledot Media is a New Zealand-based company creating online tools and training for people looking to start their own online businesses. We’re based in Christchurch, but the majority of our team work remotely from various places around the world. 

We have a full-time Shopify Selling Expert position available to work with us at SaleHoo.com (Doubledot in the parent company).

SaleHoo is a carefully curated directory of over 8,000 drop ship and wholesale suppliers. Our customers use our directory as a safer and easier way to find wholesale suppliers for goods to sell on eBay, Amazon or in their own stores.

Our new Shopify Selling Expert will play a vital role in creating dropship selling case studies/videos, selling product on Shopify, providing guidance to members through webinars and generally making sure our members receive all the help and expert advice we can give them.

We're looking for someone with great (written and on-screen) people skills, a fair amount of cleverness, the ability to Get Things Done, and a genuine desire to help the good people of the internet succeed.

You'll be responsible for:

  • Researching profitable niche ideas and sourcing suppliers for specific products. 
  • Handling Shopify listings via AliExpress and marketing products on Facebook/social media.
  • Running fortnightly webinars with our users to help answer questions they may have and educating them on product sourcing and Shopify selling.
  • Solving technical problems the customer might be having with their accounts or product sourcing.
  • Creating practical case studies of the process that is taken from product sourcing to selling on Shopify. 


You'll need:

  • An excellent understanding of selling on Shopify and experience working to get a product launched, working with Shopify on issues, and marketing and promoting products. 
  • Excellent written and spoken English and a friendly manner.
  • Meticulous attention to detail. Your spelling and grammar should be top notch.
  • Empathy and patience to deal with customers with different backgrounds and levels of technical ability. * You'll be clear, patient and pleasant.
  • Good time management skills. Since this is a remote working position, you'll need to be organized, motivated, and (dare we say) a "self-starter".
  • A background in selling online, or experience in the drop shipping industry is required.

This is the perfect position for someone who is knowledgeable and experienced with Shopify and AliExpress, loves educating people, is team-oriented and a positive person.

Neat things about working with us:

  • Flexible hours (can discuss fulltime, contract, inhouse or parttime)
  • Work from home, coffee shop or co-op space.
  • Relaxed, ego-free, family-friendly work culture

Senior Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst – Cybercrime
FireEye -Remote
Position Title: Senior Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst - CybercrimeLocation: Remote, USThe Company:FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. FireEye has over 5,600 customers across 67 countries, including more than 40 percent of the Forbes Global 2000.The Role:A Senior Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst is expected to work with minimal guidance to research, create, and communicate finished intelligence for our global commercial and government customers. The successful candidate is a seasoned analyst with a strong grasp of cybercriminal actors (i.e., financially-motivated threat actors), as well as their tactics, techniques and procedures.We encourage giving back to the community and strongly support sharing of expertise by authoring whitepapers and speaking at conferences.Responsibilities:
  • Research and craft analytic papers and deliver intelligence briefings under short deadlines on various geographical and functional topics.
  • Answer specific customer intelligence questions and requests on particular threats or concerns they encounter.
  • Identify, assess, and track tactics, techniques, and procedures of cyber threat actors.
  • Use knowledge, creativity, and analytic tradecraft best practices to obtain solutions to complex problems.
  • Work independently and collaborate throughout the FireEye organization to develop and coordinate the production of intelligence.
    • Requirements:
  • Strong subject matter expertise on cybercrime threats.
  • 2+ years of cyber intelligence experience
  • 5+ years of experience in intelligence or cybersecurity or equivalent training or education
  • Ability to express complex technical and non-technical concepts verbally, graphically, and in writing. Excellent writing skills are mandatory. Must be able to complete a writing sample during the interview process
  • Ability to demonstrate comprehensive, practical knowledge of research and collection skills as well as analytic methods
  • Strong interpersonal and communications skills with a customer-oriented attitude
  • Strong comprehension of the technical underpinnings of cybersecurity
  • Ability to participate and provide input during crisis situations
  • Self-starter with great personal initiative
    • Additional Qualifications:
    • Understanding of financial, e-commerce, healthcare, retail, or other sectors frequently affected by cybercrime.
    • Technical skills such as reverse engineering, digital forensics or digital media exploitation, network architecture, or programming.
    • Understanding of risk management, risk assessment, and risk communication functions.
    • Foreign language skills in Russian, Chinese, Arabic, Farsi, and / or major European languages
    • Undergraduate or graduate degree with focus on intelligence studies, security studies, political science, international relations, criminal justice, journalism, computer science, cybersecurity, or similar concentration.
    FireEye is an Equal Opportunity Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.#LI-AO1
